an7.57:4.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Vesālī, at the Great Wood, in the hall with the peaked roof.
an7.57:4.3: Then General Sīha went up to the Buddha,
an7.57:4.4: bowed, sat down to one side,
an7.57:4.6: “Sir, can you point out a fruit of giving visible in this very life?”
an7.57:5.1: “Well then, Sīha, I’ll ask you about this in return, and you can answer as you like.
an7.57:5.2: What do you think, Sīha? Consider two people.
an7.57:5.3: One is faithless, mean, stingy, and abusive. One is a faithful donor who loves charity.
an7.57:5.4: Which do you think the perfected ones will show compassion for first?”
an7.57:6.1: “Why would the perfected ones first show compassion for the person who is faithless, mean, and abusive?
an7.57:6.2: They’d show compassion first for the faithful donor who loves charity.”
an7.57:7.1: “Which do you think the perfected ones will first approach?”
an7.57:7.4: “They’d first approach the faithful donor who loves charity.”
an7.57:8.1: “Which do you think the perfected ones will receive alms from first?”
an7.57:8.4: “They’d receive alms first from the faithful donor who loves charity.”
an7.57:9.1: “Which do you think the perfected ones will teach the Dharma to first?”
an7.57:9.4: “They’d first teach the Dharma to the faithful donor who loves charity.”
an7.57:10.1: “Which do you think would get a good reputation?”
an7.57:10.4: “The faithful donor who loves charity would get a good reputation.”
an7.57:11.1: “Which do you think would enter any kind of assembly bold and assured, whether it’s an assembly of aristocrats, brahmins, householders, or ascetics?”
an7.57:11.3: “The faithful donor who loves charity would enter any kind of assembly bold and assured, whether it’s an assembly of aristocrats, brahmins, householders, or ascetics.”
an7.57:12.1: “When their body breaks up, after death, which do you think would be reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm?”
an7.57:12.3: “Why would the person who is faithless, mean, and abusive be reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm?
an7.57:12.4: The faithful donor who loves charity would, when their body breaks up, after death, be reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.
an7.57:13.1: When it comes to these fruits of giving visible in this very life, I don’t have to rely on faith in the Buddha,
an7.57:13.3: I’m a giver, a donor, and the perfected ones show compassion for me first.
an7.57:13.4: I’m a giver, and the perfected ones approach me first.
an7.57:13.5: I’m a giver, and the perfected ones receive alms from me first.
an7.57:13.6: I’m a giver, and the perfected ones teach me Dharma first.
an7.57:13.7: I’m a giver, and I have this good reputation:
an7.57:13.8: ‘General Sīha gives, serves, and attends on the Saṅgha.’
an7.57:13.9: I’m a giver, I enter any kind of assembly bold and assured,
an7.57:13.10: whether it’s an assembly of aristocrats, brahmins, householders, or ascetics.
an7.57:13.11: When it comes to these fruits of giving visible in this very life, I don’t have to rely on faith in the Buddha,
an7.57:13.14: ‘When a giver’s body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.’ I don’t know this,
an7.57:13.15: so I have to rely on faith in the Buddha.”
an7.57:13.16: “That’s so true, Sīha! That’s so true!
an7.57:13.17: When a giver’s body breaks up, after death, they’re reborn in a good place, a heavenly realm.”
